14.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
14.str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.

14.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
14.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.

14.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
14.str2: From ana and choreo; to retire.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

15.str2: (a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.

15.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
15.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
End of life, death. From teleutao; decease.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

15.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
15.str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

15.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
15.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

16.str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
16.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
16.str2: To mock, ridicule. From en and paizo; to jeer at, i.e. Deride.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sorcerer, a magician, a wizard. Of foreign origin; a Magian, i.e. Oriental scientist; by implication, a magician.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
16.str2: To provoke to anger; pass: To be wroth or very angry. From thumos; to put in a passion, i.e. Enrage.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
16.str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
16.str2: From ana and haireomai; to take up, i.e. Adopt; by implication, to take away, i.e. Abolish, murder.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from paio; a boy, or, a girl, and a child; specially, a slave or servant.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Bethlehem, a town of Judea. Of Hebrew origin; Bethleem, a place in Palestine.
And, even, also, namely.

From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Two years old, lasting two years. From dis and etos; of two years.
And, even, also, namely.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

Weeping, lamentation, crying. From klaio; lamentation.
